{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3159188,"name":"Yoav","username":"Yoav-R","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/yoav-r/{size}/270665_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-07T14:51:42.074Z","cooked":"

When running the robot, I get these log messages in the riolog.
I was wondering what these messages means and why is there a “socket error”.

Here I ran the robot with a raspberry pi connected to it:

WithRPI706×187 50.6 KB

I get similar behavior when the raspberry pi is disconnected:

WithoutRPI736×97 22.1 KB

What version of wpilib/network tables are you running? There have been numerous fixes this year some of which fox disconnections. You should be running 2024.4.1 or later.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2023-03-07T14:58:29.632Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":27.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":429258,"topic_slug":"strange-behavior-with-the-communication-nt4","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/strange-behavior-with-the-communication-nt4/429258/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3159249,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-07T16:13:29.074Z","cooked":"

As Joe said, make sure you upgrade to 2023.4.1 or later.

It’s not unusual to see multiple client connections from the same client and then the other side disconnect; what’s happening is that the NT client tries to connect a bunch of different ways in parallel; once one succeeds, it cancels/disconnects the others.
